pulsesuite.libpulsesuite.logger¶

Author: Rahul R. Sah

Module Contents¶

Classes¶

Logger

High-performance logger for scientific/HPC applications.
class pulsesuite.libpulsesuite.logger.Logger(logLevel=LOGSTD, output=sys.stdout)¶

Bases: contextlib.ContextDecorator

High-performance logger for scientific/HPC applications.

Provides log levels, error/warning/info/debug, and assertion logic. Thread-safe and context-enabled. All methods use camelCase.

Parameters:

  • logLevel (int, optional) – Initial log level (default: 2 = LOGSTD)

  • output (file-like, optional) – Output stream (default: sys.stdout)

LOGERROR = 0¶
LOGWARN = 1¶
LOGSTD = 2¶
LOGVERBOSE = 3¶
LOGDEBUG = 4¶
LOGDEBUG2 = 5¶
LOGDEBUG3 = 6¶
LOGNAMES = ['ERROR  ', 'WARNING', 'STD    ', 'VERBOSE', 'DEBUG  ', 'DEBUG2 ', 'DEBUG3 ']¶
__enter__()¶
__exit__(exc_type, exc_val, exc_tb)¶
classmethod getInstance()¶

Singleton access to the logger.

setLogLevel(level)¶

Set the log level.

getLogLevel()¶

Get the current log level.

incrLogLevel()¶

Increase the log level by 1.

decrLogLevel()¶

Decrease the log level by 1.

getLogLevelStr(level=None)¶

Get the string representation of a log level.

error(msg, exitCode=1, file=None, line=None)¶

Log an error message and exit.

Parameters:

  • msg (str) – The error message.

  • exitCode (int, optional) – Exit code (default: 1)

  • file (str, optional) – File name for error location.

  • line (int, optional) – Line number for error location.

assertTrue(test, msg, file=None, line=None)¶

Assert that a condition is true, else log error and exit.

Parameters:

  • test (bool) – Condition to check.

  • msg (str) – Message to log if assertion fails.

  • file (str, optional) – File name for error location.

  • line (int, optional) – Line number for error location.

warning(msg, file=None, line=None)¶

Log a warning message.

std(msg, file=None, line=None)¶

Log a standard message.

verbose(msg, file=None, line=None)¶

Log a verbose message.

debug(msg, file=None, line=None)¶

Log a debug message.

debug2(msg, file=None, line=None)¶

Log a debug2 message.

debug3(msg, file=None, line=None)¶

Log a debug3 message.
